7.14.19  2:14 pm   for the history vids did you record the narration and the score in the same program so that you could play the instruments "in time" with your talking

      you don't need to use the same program to record things along to something. just bring the track over from the other program

7.14.19  12:31 pm   Hey Bill. A couple weeks ago, I started making music. It's nothing crazy or anything, but it's just that lately I haven't been enjoying video games quite as much so it's something else to do. I kind of have two questions, though. Firstly, I was wondering how you start writing a song.

     any way. this can be confusing until you are able to convince yourself that you statistically might do it everyway

      For me, I've just hit a few piano notes at random until I heard a little melody that I liked just by coincidence and that's where I start,

     that's the way normal, sensible people do it, and i only discovered that trick very recently. it works fantastically well, i don't know why i was ever so afraid of it

      but it sort of feels like I'm cheating because I imagine real musicians put a lot more thought into their music.

     music is everywhere. think as little or as much as you want. think a medium amount. go back and forth between the amounts and levels at which you think. there is music to be woven in and among any and all or none of those states

      My other question is: do you think it's okay for songs to be short. I've never made anything longer than a minute. Maybe this was a weird question, I dunno. Thanks though.

      if you want them to get on spotify, you're going to have to go through a lot of work to get them to accept it if it's under a minute. so i suppose at that point, the next question you would have to ask yourself is is it ok to not be on spotify

7.13.19  8:58 pm   hello, i am trying to find a way to harmonize vocals but all i seem to find are complex theoretical explanations regarding many different scenarios, but i just want to know a basic way to harmonize vocals in order to sound nice, could you help me?

      listen to some songs (ones you like). once you begin to enjoy them, try the trick where you are only allowed to harmonize 1 word of the entire song. this will stop you from thinking about what note to use (that's the second more important question) and first think about the first most important question which is when to do it

      it's not so much a style, it's a method

7.13.19  5:23 am   Your songs are quite open to interpretation. That being said, every time I listen to them, I find new meaning of song but they always touch same fuzzy string in my soul very few things can touch... When you make songs do you make them with specific meaning in your mind or are they open to understand in a way person wants to, even from your perspective?

     the objective is to touch precisely the fuzzy string you mentioned

      P.S. I find your art absolutely wonderful, mixing passion and unicorns to create amazing things in this world

      that's nice of you
